citations.narrative:
The licensee had a skunk named "Casper" that was taken to an event in September 2024. During the event, a child
walked past the cones that were set up as a barrier and stuck her finger in the cage the skunk was kept in. The girl was
bit on her finger by the skunk. The skunk had to be euthanized so it could be tested for rabies.
Not having an appropriate barrier in place to prevent a person from putting their fingers in the enclosure doesn't ensure
the safety of the public and the animals.
Appropriate barriers need to be put in place so as to prevent any incidents where a member of the public could get bit
from a regulated animal.
Correct starting on 4/4/25.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
End of report.

Not having an appropriate barrier in place to prevent a person from putting their fingers in the enclosure doesn't ensure
